item.title: BR: Middlemarch
item.description: Middlemarch by George Eliot A book that was lauded (by Woolf) as the only British novel written for grownups. I dislike Woolf and I am not even sure why. There’s something off-putting in how her name, in combination with titles of some of her works, is perceived by me. But I also disliked “George Eliot” without knowing exactly why. That was a long time ago, well before I knew it was a ‘she’ and not a ‘he’, and “George Eliot” was a pseudonym.
